references.paper_title: A simple framework for contrastive learning of visual representations
references.reason: This paper introduces contrastive learning, a crucial technique used in the proposed CTR method for learning distinguishable trajectory representations.
This paper is highly relevant as it explores a similar problem of encouraging multi-agent diversity in MARL, providing a valuable baseline and comparison for the proposed CTR method.

references.paper_title: Improving multi-agent reinforcement learning with progressive mutual information collaboration
references.reason: This paper offers another approach to multi-agent diversity using mutual information, highlighting the ongoing research in this area and providing context for the CTR method.

references.paper_title: QMIX: Monotonic value function factorization for deep multi-agent reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper presents QMIX, a foundational MARL algorithm upon which the CTR method is implemented, showcasing the practical relevance and application of the proposed approach.

This paper introduces the StarCraft Multi-Agent Challenge (SMAC) benchmark, a crucial testbed for evaluating the performance and effectiveness of the proposed CTR method in complex multi-agent scenarios.
